DataElement.preferredName: Image Study Primary Anatomic Site Sequence of Items Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text describing an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position specifying the primary anatomic structure(s) of interest in this imaging Instance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.:A coded value specifying the anatomic site of the entity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the anatomic site of the entity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 1/1/24 upd OC to Imaging Study C63859. jk;  11/11/23 Created for CDS-Imaging template. BF;

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: SQ: Text used to describe named areas of the body as an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position starting with 1 as defined in the 2007 DICOM, Part 5, Paragraph 7.5 Nesting of Data Sets. Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.
